children.value: Practice applying Taylor’s theorem and implementing finite difference methods. These exercises build both theoretical understanding and computational skills.
Test your understanding with these conceptual questions:
Can you write down Taylor’s theorem with the Lagrange form of the remainder? What conditions on

children.html: fff

children.value: Given a finite difference formula, can you derive its error using Taylor expansions?
What does it mean for a method to be “first-order” or “second-order” accurate? How do you verify this computationally?
Can you implement forward and central difference approximations in Python?
Why do we use log-log plots to verify convergence rates? What slope should you expect for first-order and second-order methods?
Why does the error start to increase for very small

children.html: hhh
